thing-type.label: ZSE33 Smart Chime/Alarm
thing-type.description: Smart Chime/Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSmart Chime/Alarm</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtAudio and visual notifications triggered by other Z-Wave devices or scheduled in your routine</li&gt <li&gtChoose from 10 different sounds for chime and siren modes</li&gt <li&gtAdvanced configuration available</li&gt <li&gtPowerful long-lasting batteries</li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Plus with improved 500 chip for faster and safer wireless communication</li&gt <li&gtSmall size and quick installation</li&gt <li&gtZ-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz</li&gt <li&gtPower: 2 CR123 batteries (included)</li&gt <li&gtPower Consumption: 2W</li&gt <li&gtOperating Temperature: 32 – 104 F</li&gt <li&gtRange: Up to 100 feet line of sight</li&gt <li&gtInstallation and Use: Indoor only</li&gt <li&gtDimensions: 2.7” x 1.2”</li&gt <li&gtWeight: 3 oz</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtAuto Inclusion:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in inclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtCarefully remove the cover from the device</li&gt <li&gtRemove the plastic pull-tab from the battery slot – the Chime will automatically enter inclusion mode for 20 seconds</li&gt <li&gtA new alarm siren / doorbell device will appear on your controller's device list</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtManual Inclusion:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtBring the Smart Chime within direct range of your controller</li&gt <li&gtCarefully remove the cover from the device</li&gt <li&gtRemove the plastic pull-tab from the battery slot. The LED indicator will blink slowly</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in inclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button on the Smart Chime 3 TIMES quickly. The LED indicator will flash quickly</li&gt <li&gtA new alarm siren / doorbell device will appear on your controller's device list (if it connects as an on/off switch, you may need to change the device type manually. Contact us for instructions).</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the Smart Chime is powered on and located within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway controller</li&gt <li&gtPut your Z-Wave controller in exclusion mode</li&gt <li&gtPress and release the Z-Wave button 3 TIMES quickly. The LED indicator will flash quickly</li&gt <li&gtThe Smart Chime should disappear from your controller's device list</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtIf the first attempt is unsuccessful, please repeat the process following all steps carefully.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Siren Volume
parameter.description: 3 volume levels for the alarm siren sound.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValues: 1 – low, 2 – medium, 3 – high (default)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Siren Alarm Duration
parameter.description: 5 modes to set the duration for siren alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – alarm is off</p&gt <p&gt1 – alarm goes off for 30 seconds</p&gt <p&gt2 – alarm goes off for 60 seconds</p&gt <p&gt3 – alarm goes off for 5 minutes</p&gt <p&gt255 – alarm continues until battery drains</p&gt <p&gtValues: 0, 1 – 3, 255; 1 – default setting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Chime Sound Duration
parameter.description: Chime Sound Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gthow many times the chime should repeat the doorbell sound once triggered by a BASIC_SET alarm command from a door sensor.</p&gt <p&gtValues: 0 – chime is off, 1 – 254 (cycles); 255 – chime</p&gt <p&gtsound continues until battery drains; 2 – default setting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Chime Volume
parameter.description: 3 volume levels for the doorbell sound. Set volume to low, medium, or high.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValues: 1 – low, 2 – medium, 3 – high (default)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Siren Alarm Tone
parameter.description: 10 different tones for alarm siren<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValues: 1-10; 10 – default setting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Chime Tone
parameter.description: 10 different tones for doorbell<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValues: 1-10; 4 – default setting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Siren Alarm or Chime Mode
parameter.description: Siren Alarm or Chime Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSwitch between Siren Alarm (configu-red by parameters 1, 2, 5, 8) and Chime / Doorbell (parameters 3, 4, 6, 9) modes.</p&gt <p&gtValues: 1 – Siren Alarm enabled; 2 – Chime enabled (default).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: LED Notifications for Siren Alarm
parameter.description: LED Notifications for Siren Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable visual alarm for Siren mode. The LED will blink when triggered.</p&gt <p&gtValues: 0 – LED disabled; 1 – LED enabled (default).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: LED Notifications for Chime
parameter.description: LED Notifications for Chime<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable visual alarm for Chime mode. The LED will blink when triggered.</p&gt <p&gtValues: 0 – LED disabled (default); 1 – LED enabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 2 for status notifications to Z-Wave devices associated in this group.</p&gt <p&gtSupported command classes: SWITCH_BINARY_REPORT</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Group 3
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 3 for notifications to Z-Wave devices associated in this group.</p&gt <p&gtSupported command classes: NOTIFICATION_REPORT</p&gt
